required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study Evaluating The Efficacy Of Etanercept In Acute Gout
clinical_study.official_title: Investigator-Initiated, Pilot Study Evaluating The Efficacy Of Etanercept In Acute Gout

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot study is to investigate the safety and efficacy of etanercept (Enbrel™; Amgen) for the treatment of an acute gout attack will be non-inferior to triamcinolone acetonide an FDA approved drug to treat acute gout attacks.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be administered a single dose of etanercept 50 mg subcutaneously (SC), at the onset of an acute gout attack, or a single dose of triamcinolone acetonide 40 mg intramuscularly (IM)

primary_outcome.measure: Joint pain intensity in the most affected joint
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity in the most affected baseline joint measured by the numeric 0-10 pain scale at 72 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint pain on numeric pain scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's assessment of joint pain intensity in the most affected baseline joint on a 0-10 pain scale, at Baseline and post-dose Days

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's assessment of response to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's global assessment of response to treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's assessment of response to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment
Compare the use of rescue medication
Safety and tolerability as assessed by subjects with adverse events and serious adverse events from baseline through Visit 5 safety follow-up

arm_group.description: Subjects will be administered etanercept 50 mg subcutaneously and a placebo intramuscularly
Subjects will be administered triamcinolone acetonide 40 mg intramuscularly and a placebo subcutaneously

intervention.description: Subjects will receive 50 mg of study drug on visit 1. A second dose of study drug will be administered if the pain intensity is ≥ 5 on a pain scale of 0-10 at Visit 2
Subjects will be administered triamcinolone acetonide 40 mg intramuscularly on visit 1. A second dose of drug will be administered if the pain intensity is ≥ 5 on a pain scale of 0-10 at Visit 2

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School

facility.name: Rutgers, Robert Wood Johnson Medical School, Clinical Research Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Naomi Schlesinger, MD, Professor of Medicine
